questions.question_text: Show that √7 is irrational.
questions.answer: Assume √7 = p/q in lowest terms. Then 7q^2 = p^2 ⇒ p divisible by 7 ⇒ p=7k ⇒ q^2=7k^2 ⇒ q divisible by 7. Contradiction. Hence √7 is irrational.

questions.question_text: Find the remainder when P(x) = x^4 + 2x^3 - 5x^2 + 4x - 3 is divided by x^2 + 1. (Give the remainder as ax + b.)
questions.answer: Remainder r(x)=ax+b. Evaluate at x=i and x=-i: P(i)=3+2i, P(-i)=3-2i ⇒ r(i)=3+2i, r(-i)=3-2i ⇒ a=2, b=3. Remainder = 2x+3.

questions.question_text: The zeros of a quadratic polynomial are 4 + √7 and 4 - √7. (a) Construct a monic quadratic polynomial having these zeros and write it in standard form. (b) Factorize the polynomial and verify sum and product of zeros. (c) Evaluate the polynomial at x = 4.
questions.solution_outline: Sum = 8, Product = 9 ⇒ Polynomial: x^2 - 8x + 9. Factorization: (x - (4+√7))(x - (4-√7)). Verify by substitution. P(4) = -7.

questions.question_text: Given the pair of linear equations kx + 3y = 6 and 2x + (k - 1)y = 4: (a) Find values of k for which the system has (i) a unique solution, (ii) no solution, (iii) infinitely many solutions. (b) For k giving infinitely many solutions, find the general relation between x and y and give one particular solution.
questions.chapter: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables
questions.solution_outline: Determinant D = k(k-1)-6 = k^2-k-6=(k-3)(k+2). Unique solution when k≠3,-2. k=-2 ⇒ no solution. k=3 ⇒ infinitely many; equation reduces to x+y=2. One solution: (2,0).

questions.question_text: A pharmacist mixed two solutions containing 30% and 50% active ingredient to prepare 30 litres of a solution having 46% active ingredient. If 3 litres less of the 30% solution had been used (replaced by 3 litres more of the 50% solution), the resulting mixture would have 48% active ingredient. Determine how many litres of each solution were used in the original mixture. Show working.
questions.chapter: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables
questions.solution_outline: Let x=30% litres, y=50% litres. x+y=30. 0.30x+0.50y=13.8 ⇒ solving gives x=6, y=24. Check modified scenario yields 48%.
